New Records: Rilee Rossouw scored the first century in T20 World Cup for South Africa
Key Match Events: Rilee Rossouw scored 109 runs, Quinton de Kock scored 63 runs
Anrich Nortje took 4 wickets for 10 runs
Taskin Ahmed dropped a catch that could have changed the game
Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh had a poor bowling performance, allowing South Africa to score 205 runs
South Africa's top-class bowling performance, especially Anrich Nortje and Kagiso Rabada, destroyed the Bangladesh batting line-up
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa dominated in all three departments and with such a huge margin win, they boost their net run rate
Bangladesh's batting line-up collapsed after the fall of the first two wickets
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at the Sydney Cricket Ground
The weather played a role in the game, with the sun affecting the visibility of the ball
